name: stoic1a
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wn(w2))
-| wi(w0, wi(w2, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wn(w2))
-| wi(w0, wi(w2, w1))

|- wi(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wn(w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, w2), w1)

comment: Stoic logic Thema 1 (part a). The first thema of the four Stoic logic themata, in its basic form, was: "When from two (assertibles) a third follows, then from either of them together with the contradictory of the conclusion the contradictory of the other follows." (Apuleius Int. 209.9-14), see [Bobzien] p. 117 and ~ https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/logic-ancient/ We will represent thema 1 as two very similar rules ~ stoic1a and ~ stoic1b to represent each side. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 16-Feb-2019.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 21-May-2020.)
